recommendation: The Commission recommends that the chief executive of the New Zealand Transport Agency ensures that systems put in place by New Zealand train operators designed to mitigate this known risk are effective and result in the risk being eliminated or reduced to an acceptable level
extra_recommendation_context: Train drivers becoming distracted and forgetting the aspect of warning signals their train has recently passed is a known risk to the rail industry.  The signal alert device that was installed in train cabs to help drivers remember the aspect of the last signal their train had passed was not used by the driver on this occasion and was not widely used by other drivers because, once activated, the alarm sounded for 6 seconds and could not be cancelled and the sound was easily confused with other in-cab alarms.

recommendation: The Commission recommends the chief executive of the New Zealand Transport Agency ensures that the daily bulletins that convey critical information to rail participants is presented in a clear and unambiguous way
extra_recommendation_context: The daily bulletin was not clear to the Auckland signal box controller on the location of the work site within Tamaki Station and it was not user friendly to signal box controllers because it gave locations expressed in kilometres rather than points or signal names; the language typically used by signal box controllers.
